row-1.desc2: The version of UBL the message is based on (2.1)

row-2.desc2: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction.
row-2.rules: BII2-T01-R001 - An order MUST have a customization identifier

row-3.desc2: Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears.
row-3.rules: BII2-T01-R002 - An order MUST have a profile identifier

row-4.desc2: A transaction instance must have an identifier. The identifier enables referencing the transaction for various purposes such as from other transactions that are part of the same process.
row-4.rules: BII2-T01-R006 - An order MUST have a document identifier

row-5.desc2: The date on which the transaction instance was issued.
row-5.rules: BII2-T01-R004 - An order MUST have a document issue date

row-6.desc2: The time assigned by the buyer on which the order was issued.

row-7.desc2: "Indicates wether the order is a purchase order or consignement order. Default is purchase order.
row-7.rules: Only to be used for Consignment orders, Code=227. EUGEN-T01-R013 An order type code MUST have a list identifier attribute �UNCL1001�. OP-T01-001 OrderTypeCode in an order MUST be from UN/ECE 1001 code list PEPPOL Subset

row-9.desc2: Free form text applying to the Order. This element may contain notes or any other similar information that is not contained explicitly in another structure.

row-10.desc2: The default currency for the order.
row-10.rules: OP-T01-002 - DocumentCurrencyCode MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217 EUGEN-T01-R014 - A document currency code MUST have a list identifier attribute "ISO4217"

row-11.rules2: OP-T01-002 - The document currency code list identifier MUST be �ISO4217�

row-12.desc2: Used by the buyer to specify a reference that should be repeated in e.g. invoice to enable the buyer to automatically book e.g. to the right project, or account.

row-14.desc2: The end date for when the order is valid. The end date for the time period within which the seller must respond.
row-14.rules: BII2-T01-R005 - An order MUST provide information about its validity end date

row-15.desc: Reference to quotation which is basis for the order

row-16.desc2: A requirement to give a unique reference to the quotation that is the base for the order.

row-18.desc2: Used to reference the initial order that was rejected and a new order is issued.

row-20.desc2: A reference to Originator Document. To be able to give a reference to the internal requesition on the buyer site on which the order is based.

row-23.desc2: An identifier for the referenced document.

row-24.desc2: A short description of the document type.

row-26.desc2: The attached document embeded as binary object.

row-27.rules2: OP-T01-003 - A Binary Object MIME code attribute MUST be coded using MIME Code Type code list

row-29.desc2: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies where the external document is located.

row-31.desc2: Positive identification of the reference such as a unique identifier.

row-32.desc2: The short description of what is reference such as contract type, document type , meter etc.The type of Contract, expressed as text.

row-35.desc2: Identifies the end point of the routing service.
row-35.rules: EUGEN-T01-R011 - An endpoint identifier MUST have a scheme identifier attribute

row-36.rules2: OP-T01-004 - An Enpoint Identifier Scheme MUST be from the code list PEPPOL:PartyIdentifier

row-38.desc2: An identification for the buyer party.
row-38.rules: BII2-T01-R021 - An order MUST have the buyer party name or a buyer party identifier EUGEN-T01-R012 - A party identifier MUST have a scheme identifier attribute

row-39.rules2: OP-T01-005 - A Party Identifier Scheme MUST be from the list of PEPPOL Party Identifiers.

row-40.desc2: The name of the party who orders the listed items.
row-40.rules: BII2-T01-R021 - An order MUST have the buyer party name or a buyer party identifier

row-43.desc2: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

row-44.desc2: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

row-45.desc2: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

row-46.desc2: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

row-47.desc2: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

row-49.desc2: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2
row-49.rules: OP-T01-006 - Country codes in an order MUST be coded using ISO code list 3166-1 EUGEN-T01-R015 - A country identification code MUST have a code list identifier attribute "ISO3166-1:Alpha2"

row-52.desc2: The buyers registered Value Added Tax identifier. To be stated in case reverse charge is to apply to the purchase.

row-53.rules2: OP-T01-005 - A Party Identifier Scheme MUST be from the list of PEPPOL Party Identifiers.

row-55.desc2: Code for TaxScheme. VAT is the only allowed value

row-57.desc2: The official name of the party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.

row-58.desc2: Identifies a company as registered with the company registration scheme.

row-59.rules2: OP-T01-005 - A Party Identifier Scheme MUST be from the list of PEPPOL Party Identifiers.

row-61.name2: Buyers legal registration address city name
row-61.desc2: Associates with the registered address of the party within a Corporate Registration Scheme. The name of a city, town, or village.

row-63.name2: Buyers legal registration address country code
row-63.desc2: Buyers legal registration address country ID
row-63.rules: OP-T01-006 - Country codes in an order MUST be coded using ISO code list 3166-1

row-67.desc2: The name of the contact person.

row-68.desc2: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.

row-69.desc2: A fax number for the contact persons.

row-70.desc2: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

row-73.desc2: Identifies the end point of the routing service.
row-73.rules: EUGEN-T01-R011 - An endpoint identifier MUST have a scheme identifier attribute

row-74.rules2: OP-T01-004 - An Enpoint Identifier Scheme MUST be from the code list PEPPOL:PartyIdentifier

row-76.rules: BII2-T01-R022 - An order MUST have the seller party name or a seller party identifier EUGEN-T01-R012 - A party identifier MUST have a scheme identifier attribute

row-77.rules2: OP-T01-005 - A Party Identifier Scheme MUST be from the list of PEPPOL Party Identifiers.

row-78.rules: BII2-T01-R022 - An order MUST have the seller party name or a seller party identifier

row-79.rules: BII2-T01-R022 - An order MUST have the seller party name or a seller party identifier

row-81.desc2: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

row-82.desc2: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

row-83.desc2: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

row-84.desc2: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

row-85.desc2: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

row-87.desc2: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2
row-87.rules: OP-T01-006 - Country codes in an order MUST be coded using ISO code list 3166-1 EUGEN-T01-R015 - A country identification code MUST have a code list identifier attribute "ISO3166-1:Alpha2"

row-90.desc2: The name of the contact person.

row-91.desc2: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.

row-92.desc2: A fax number for the contact persons.

row-93.desc2: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

row-94.desc: Information regarding the originator of the order

row-97.rules: EUGEN-T01-R012 - A party identifier MUST have a scheme identifier attribute

row-98.rules2: OP-T01-005 - A Party Identifier Scheme MUST be from the list of PEPPOL Party Identifiers.

row-102.desc2: The name of the contact person.

row-103.desc2: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.

row-104.desc2: A fax number for the contact persons.

row-105.desc2: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

row-106.desc: Information regarding the receiver of the invoice based on the order (Invoicee)

row-108.desc2: Identifies the end point of the routing service.
row-108.rules: EUGEN-T01-R011 - An endpoint identifier MUST have a scheme identifier attribute

row-109.rules2: OP-T01-004 - An Endpoint Identifier Scheme MUST be from the list of PEPPOL Party Identifiers.

row-111.desc2: An identification for the invoicee party.
row-111.rules: EUGEN-T01-R012 - A party identifier MUST have a scheme identifier attribute

row-112.rules2: OP-T01-005 - A Party Identifier Scheme MUST be from the list of PEPPOL Party Identifiers.

row-114.desc2: The name of the party who should be invoiced for the ordered items.

row-116.desc2: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.
row-116.example2: The main address line in the postal address, usually the street name and number

row-117.desc2: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

row-118.desc2: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

row-119.desc2: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

row-120.desc2: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

row-122.desc2: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2
row-122.rules: OP-T01-006 - Country codes in an order MUST be coded using ISO code list 3166-1EUGEN-T01-R015 - A country identification code MUST have a code list identifier attribute "ISO3166-1:Alpha2"

row-125.desc2: The invoicees registered Value Added Tax identifier

row-127.desc2: Code for TaxScheme. VAT is the only allowed value

row-129.desc2: The official name of the party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.

row-130.desc2: Identifies a company as registered with the company registration scheme.

row-132.desc2: Associates with the registered address of the party within a Corporate Registration Scheme. The name of a city, town, or village.

row-134.desc2: Invoicee legal registration address country ID
row-134.rules: OP-T01-006 - Country codes in an order MUST be coded using ISO code list 3166-1EUGEN-T01-R015 - A country identification code MUST have a code list identifier attribute "ISO3166-1:Alpha2"

row-141.desc2: An identifer for the location to where the ordered items should be delivered.

row-143.desc2: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

row-144.desc2: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

row-145.desc2: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

row-146.desc2: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

row-147.desc2: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

row-149.desc2: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2
row-149.rules: OP-T01-006 - Country codes in an invoice MUST be coded using ISO code list 3166-1 EUGEN-T01-R015 - A country identification code MUST have a code list identifier attribute "ISO3166-1:Alpha2"

row-152.desc2: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period.

row-153.desc2: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.

row-156.desc2: An identifier for the party that should deliver the ordered items.In this BIS: The identifier of the party that should receive the ordered items

row-157.rules2: OP-T01-005 - An Party Identifier Scheme MUST be from the list of PEPPOL Party Identifiers.

row-159.desc2: The name of the party that should handle the delivery.In this BIS: The name of the party that should receive the delivery

row-160.desc: Contact information for the delivery party

row-161.desc2: The name of the contact person.

row-162.desc2: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.

row-163.desc2: A fax number for the contact persons.

row-164.desc2: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

row-166.desc2: The ability for the buyer to specify what shipping terms should apply the delivery of the order.

row-168.desc2: A description of special conditions relating to the Delivery Terms.

row-170.desc2: An association to Location, e.g., a port. The unique identifier for the location.

row-172.desc2: Payment terms for the order described in text

row-173.desc: Allowances and charges for the order

row-175.desc2: A textual reason for the allowance or the charge. Can also be its name.
row-175.rules: BII2-T01-R007 - Allowances and charges MUST have a reason

row-176.desc2: The net amount of the allowance or the charge exluding VAT.

row-177.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-179.desc2: The total VAT amount that is "added to the document total w/o VAT". This is the sum of all VAT subcategory amounts.An association to the total tax amount of the Order (as calculated by the Buyer). The expected Tax Total in the corresponding invoice.. The total tax amount for particular tax scheme e.g. VAT; the sum of each of the tax subtotals for each tax category within the tax scheme. Sum of line tax amounts. An association to the total tax amount of the Order (as calculated by the Buyer). The expected Tax Total in the corresponding invoice.
row-179.rules: BII2-T01-R018 - VAT total amount SHOULD be the sum of order line tax amounts, if order line tax amounts are provided

row-180.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-181.desc: Estimated total amounts for the order

row-182.desc2: Sum of line amounts in the document.The total of Line Extension Amounts net of tax and settlement discounts, but inclusive of any applicable rounding amount.
row-182.rules: BII2-T01-R013 - Expected total sum of line amounts MUST NOT be negative, if expected total sum of line amounts is provided. BII2-T01-R014 - Expected total sum of line amounts MUST equal the sum of the order line amounts at order line level, if expected total sum of line amounts is provided

row-183.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-184.desc2: The "Sum of line amounts" plus "sum of allowances on document level" plus "sum of charges on document level".

row-185.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-187.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-188.name2: Sum of allowances on document level
row-188.desc2: Sum of all allowances on header level in the document. Allowances on line level are included in the line amount and summed up into the "sum of line amounts"
row-188.rules: BII2-T01-R015 - Expected total sum of allowance at document level MUST be equal to the sum of allowance amounts at document level, if expected total sum of allowance at document level is provided

row-189.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-190.name2: Sum of charges on document level
row-190.desc2: Sum of all charge on header level in the document. Charges on line level are included in the line amount and summed up into the "sum of line amounts"
row-190.rules: BII2-T01-R016 - Expected total sum of charges at document level MUST be equal to the sum of charges at document level, if expected total sum of charges at document level is provided

row-191.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-192.desc2: Any amounts that have been paid a-priory.

row-193.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-194.desc2: Any rounding of the "Document total including VAT"

row-195.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-196.desc2: The amount that is expected to be paid based on the document. This amount is the "Document total including VAT" less the "paid amounts" that have been paid a-priori.The total amount to be paid. Estimated total amount of order including VAT
row-196.rules: BII2-T01-R017 - Expected total amount for payment MUST be equal to the sum of line amounts minus sum of allowances at document level plus sum of charges at document level and VAT total amount, if expected total amount for payment is provided, BII2-T01-R012 - Expected total amount for payment MUST NOT be negative, if expected total amount for payment is provided

row-197.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-199.desc2: Free-form text applying to the Order Line. This element may contain notes or any other similar information that is not contained explicitly in another structure. Is to capture any free form description related to the order line as a whole.

row-201.desc2: Identifies the Line Item assigned by the buyer.
row-201.rules: BII2-T01-R003 - Each order line MUST have a document line identifier that is unique within the order

row-202.desc2: The quantity of Items for the Line Item. The quantity for the order line.
row-202.rules: BII2-T01-R010 - Each order line ordered quantity MUST not be negative, BII2-T01-R029 - Each order line SHOULD have an ordered quantity, BII2-T01-R030 - Each order line ordered quantity MUST have an assosiated unit of measure.

row-203.rules2: OP-T01-009 - Unit code MUST be coded according to the UN/ECE Recommendation 20 (2009) EUGEN-T01-R016 - A unit code attribute MUST have a unit code list identifier attribute "UNECREC20"

row-205.desc2: The total amount for the Line Item, including Allowance Charges but net of taxes. The expected line amount excluding VAT but inclusive of other charges, allowances and taxes.

row-206.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-207.desc2: The total tax amount for the Line Item. The total amounts of taxes on the line.

row-208.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-209.desc2: Indicates if the line items must be delivered in a single shipment. Default that partial delivery is allowed.

row-210.desc2: The buyer's accounting information applied to the Line Item, expressed as text.

row-211.desc: Delivery information for the order line

row-212.desc: Requested delivery period for the order line

row-213.desc2: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period.

row-214.desc2: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.

row-215.desc: Information regarding the originator of the order line

row-218.rules2: OP-T01-005 - A Party Identifier Scheme MUST be from the list of PEPPOL Party Identifiers.

row-222.desc2: The net price of an item including discounts or surcharges that apply to the price.Although price is an optional element in an order it recommended as best practice to either state the price or provide reference to an appropriate source from which the price can be identified such as a contract, catalogue or a quote.. The price amount. The net price of the item including all allowances, charges and taxes but exluding VAT.
row-222.rules: BII2-T01-R011 - Each order line item net price MUST not be negative

row-223.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-224.desc2: The actual quantity to which the price applies.

row-225.rules2: OP-T01-009 - Unit code MUST be coded according to the UN/ECE Recommendation 20 (2009) EUGEN-T01-R016 - A unit code attribute MUST have a unit code list identifier attribute "UNECREC20"

row-227.desc: Allowance and charge information connected to price

row-229.desc2: The net amount for the allowance charge connected to the price

row-230.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-231.desc2: The gross price of the item before subtracting discounts. E.g. list price.

row-232.rules: OP-T01-007 - currencyID MUST be coded using ISO code list 4217

row-234.desc2: Free-form field that can be used to give a text description of the item. A detailed description of the item. Use one description per language.Test text for capturing notes

row-235.desc2: A short name for an item.A short name optionally given to an item, such as a name from a Catalogue, as distinct from a description.
row-235.rules: BII2-T01-R031 - Each order line MUST have an item identifier and/or an item name

row-237.desc2: The sellers identifier for the item.Associates the item with its identification according to the seller's system. The sellers ID for the item.
row-237.rules: BII2-T01-R031 - Each order line MUST have an item identifier and/or an item name

row-239.desc2: A item identifier based on a registered schema.Associates the item with its identification according to a standard system. Standarized ID for the item
row-239.rules: BII2-T01-R031 - Each order line MUST have an item identifier and/or an item name.

row-242.desc2: Reference to an external document (ID) when it is necessary to specify the details of the item.

row-243.desc: Classification of the commodity on the order line

row-244.desc2: A classification code for classifying the item by its type or nature.

row-247.desc2: The VAT code that indicates what VAT details apply to the item.
row-247.rules: EUGEN-T01-R017 - A tax category identifier MUST have a scheme identifier attribute �UNECE5305�

row-248.rules2: OP-T01-008 - A tax category identifier scheme MUST be �UNCL5305�

row-249.desc2: The VAT percentage rate that applies to the ordered item.

row-251.desc2: Code for TaxScheme. VAT is the only allowed value

row-253.rules: BII2-T01-R019 - Each item property MUST have a data name, if item property is provided

row-254.rules: BII2-T01-R020 - Each item property MUST have a data value, if item property is provided

row-256.rules2: Must be a valid code according to code list UN/ECE Rec 20
